thread.title: 'BBC dad' announces CNN interview with the perfect dad joke
thread.title_full: 'BBC dad' announces CNN interview with the perfect dad joke

author: Sam Haysom
title: 'BBC dad' announces CNN interview with the perfect dad joke
text:
This could well be the final swansong for the sweet, viral phenomena that was BBC dad .
SEE ALSO: Everybody shut up. Just let us enjoy the kids in the BBC video.
It's now been 12 days since the glorious video of Professor Robert Kelly's children gatecrashing his BBC interview went massively viral, and ‚Äî after numerous parodies , think pieces and an eventual press conference ‚Äî Kelly appears to be returning to life as normal.
That didn't mean there wasn't time for one final Twitter joke before his appearance on CNN, though.
I'll be on @cnni in an hour to talk about North Korea. And yes, the CNN producer made sure to tell me to lock my door
‚Äî Robert E Kelly (@Robert_E_Kelly) March 22, 2017
Vintage BBC dad.
500 retweets later, though, and Twitter clearly wasn't ready to let go.
@Robert_E_Kelly noooo! we want Marion!
‚Äî Anna Fifield (@annafifield) March 22, 2017
@Robert_E_Kelly @cnni let them join you!
‚Äî NorthKoreaRealTime (@BuckTurgidson79) March 22, 2017
@Robert_E_Kelly @cnni Your children are precious! And I want Marion to come be president of the U.S. üëßüèΩüë∂üèΩ
‚Äî Kersti (@Kersti2016) March 22, 2017
An hour later, as promised, Kelly was live on CNN. It was like d√©j√† vu.
This looks familiar.
Image: cnn
Kelly was rocking a badass new tie, but apart from that almost everything was unchanged. The door over his left shoulder looked like it was ready to burst open at any moment.
And then... nothing. No there were no unexpected interruptions, no mentions of the famous interview from the hosts, and ‚Äî most tragically of all ‚Äî no unexpected appearance from Marion. The door remained closed.
All good things have to end at some point.
We wish you all the best in your future endeavours, BBC dad.
WATCH: The BBC interview kids just stole the show again
